title: collinscoinz
author: collinscoinz
content: Please am new here and i realy want to know,and lean more about this forum and it operation.how can some one that is new like me lean any thing important from this forum that will be of benefit to those that are new.when no body is ready to teach or reply topics,i want to ask how can some one have his own wallet, have seen the benefits of this forum from a friend that introduced me,i wanna grow also like others so please forum mates please help me out share knowledge with me that can help me as well be of help also to others thanks very much..

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: It's pretty hard to understand what you are looking for. Better you clearly write your questions. Well, to have your own wallet, you can try Hardware wallet. If you can't afford one, I would recommend Electrum for Bitcoin.Please write something with proper punctuation marks. It's hard to understand your text lol. Or you can try the local board.

comments.author: Aliosky
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum. Its a simple forum once u abide the rules and regulations.Here are some important links for you i hope tou get a look at themhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1631151.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=178608.0

comments.author: bullrun2024bro
comments.body: Quote from: collinscoinz on February 07, 2023, 02:44:10 PM~Try to use a translator, it's pretty hard to understand what you're trying to say (or check if there is a local board available for your native language).Anyway, if you're new check out these threads, if haven't read them already:1. [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?2. Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ3. FAQ: Everything you need to know about forum 'activity, account ranks and merit

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: The problem with you is you are not roaming around and not checking sections that matter the most for newbies like you I checked your post history and 90% of your post are on Politics and Society, go to the section about your concern if it is a wallet then go to the wallet section, be sure you are fully aware of the forum rules, like activity and ranking up and these are newbies should learn a lot if you want to stay here for a long time.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3531345;sa=showPosts

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: What you can benefit from Bitcointalk is almost the same things that you can benefit on other social platforms like Facebook/Twitter/etc. Bitcointalk is just older generation, with it having the classic internet forum style.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: First things first to avoid being overwhelmed (you seem overwhelmed though)- Comprehensive guide to Bitcointalk. Newbie friendly + calculator and infographic - This is by far the easiest and the most structured process to help you get started. The link includes additional resources that will answer your question specifically how to create a wallet. Spare some weeks reading, and ask questions only when there is something you don't clearly understand Â That's how you can benefit from the forum.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: collinscoinz on February 07, 2023, 02:44:10 PMPlease am new here and i realy want to know,and lean more about this forum and it operation.how can some one that is new like me lean any thing important from this forum that will be of benefit to those that are new.There's no way we all can help you without you first helping yourself, firstly you need to be active, you need to learn and read through the forum by taking your taime to understand the way you're expected to behave here, remember there are rules guiding this community which means you can't just do anyhow here, after carefully studying the forum and understanding it's rules and regulations, posting etiquettes and so on, you will know build yourself to learning about bitcoin as well to help you have something as well to contribute to others coming here after you as newbies.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on February 07, 2023, 03:42:18 PMWhat you can benefit from Bitcointalk is almost the same things that you can benefit on other social platforms like Facebook/Twitter/etc. Bitcointalk is just older generation, with it having the classic internet forum style.Never mind me but I just want to give my own opinion. I have been on social media many years before I joined this forum, but this forum helped me more than anything, I still remember many scam I wanted to fall for that lack of money did not let me fall for at that time. This forum educated me, I want to help newbies on this forum, I made research and I learn and know more while I also know more from what established posters are posting. In short, this forum is far better than those social media if it is about knowing about how to protect oneself from scam and hack and some other things. I better be on this forum that staying on most social media.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: You can do whatever you want as long as it doesn't cause trouble for anyone and your good to go. This forum is much like social media platform but the difference between this forum and other platforms is that this forum is more focused on cryptocurrency stuff and other related matters. Asking how or what to do?. You are exactly doing it when you have posted here about what to do and to add more of that which is to read, learn and do the things you have learned so far, keeping wallet safe, detecting scam projects, etc. Just don't break the rules.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: collinscoinz on February 07, 2023, 02:44:10 PM~Hey there! Welcome to the forum. I understand you are here to learn and grow. This forum is a great place to do just that.One way to do that and to get the most out of this platform is to ask questions and participate in discussions. There is likely someone here who has the information you are looking for and would be happy to help. But if you are new, it may be a good idea to do some reading first. There is a section on this board with sticky topics which has some useful information for newcomers. Also, I recommend checking out the rules before posting; they will help you avoid any confusion or misunderstandings with other members: Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQSo if you have a question, ask! If you know the answer to someone else's question, share your knowledge by responding. The more we all participate and help each other out, the more we will all learn. Happy to have you as a part of the community!

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.body: The forum members will respond to your questions if you write well. Your post is quite difficult to understand.As a new member of this forum, you have a lot to learn about cryptocurrencies from this forum. Explore the forum's various boards and sub-forums to familiarize yourself with the postings that have been made.You can only advance in the forum if you read, participate, contribute thoughtfully, refrain from spamming, and abide by its policies.

comments.author: Alisha-k
comments.body: New here, you're welcome.I understand your both questions is how to grow in the forum and create a wallet.First, to grow in the forum you have to be ready to learn, relearn and possibly unlearn because definitely you'll see so many leading and misleading articles.Then to create a wallet, try the hardware wallet.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: The difference of forum to other hub for discussion is that its more focus on the bitcoin side and seriousness of the conversation. Its not the same with facebook or twitter that only focus on trends and likes. Here the like is called merits which can be use as parameter for ranking up and become a higher rank someday. Welcome to the forum, my suggestion is that focus on the reading aspect and more learning on rules and regulations here. Follow them, and be respectful. Surely youll be an asset of the forum in the future.

comments.author: CageMabok
comments.body: Quote from: collinscoinz on February 07, 2023, 02:44:10 PMPlease am new here and i realy want to know,and lean more about this forum and it operation.how can some one that is new like me lean any thing important from this forum that will be of benefit to those that are new.when no body is ready to teach or reply topics,i want to ask how can some one have his own wallet, have seen the benefits of this forum from a friend that introduced me,i wanna grow also like others so please forum mates please help me out share knowledge with me that can help me as well be of help also to others thanks very much.. You have now received some of the best advice from anyone here or in this forum. Obviously the advice they give is very helpful and useful for you as a newbie here. But there are other things that are also very important for you to apply within yourself now. It is consistent and focused when studying and don't get bored easily or feel frustrated when you haven't gotten any results from your own efforts or after you have learned a lot of things here. Because there are many newbies who start to surrender to their own conditions when they haven't gotten anything in this forum. But I just hope that you are not like that and can be more diligent in studying so that you can get success here in the future.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: People above gave you some topics to learn and understand better about the forum. I only gave you some more.[Guide] Searching effectively. Searching skill is always important for you on Internet exclusively this forum.Bitcointalk posting etiquette. Having good writing skill will help you to express your opinion better. When others can understand your posts better, they can give you better advice or appreciate your help.Lastly, forum has some hidden pages and features that you should knowHidden pages/ features on the forum

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: collinscoinz on February 07, 2023, 02:44:10 PMPlease am new here and i realy want to know,and lean more about this forum and it operation.how can some one that is new like me lean any thing important from this forum that will be of benefit to those that are new.when no body is ready to teach or reply topics,i want to ask how can some one have his own wallet, have seen the benefits of this forum from a friend that introduced me,i wanna grow also like others so please forum mates please help me out share knowledge with me that can help me as well be of help also to others thanks very much.. Welcome to this wonderful forum, this is a forum where you can learn anything you want about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general by simply asking a question, because the forum users are eager to help, and you can also be the helper if you have enough knowledge to solve someone's problem.Growing in this forum is normal as long as you are very active in it, follow the forum rules and regulations, create important and very knowledgeable threads, and provide very good and quality replies to some discussions.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: You're welcome to bitcointalk forum where you can learn many things cryptocurrency and bitcoin.All you have to do is to follow the rules and regulation there many things that are not allowed in these forum.1: plagiarism2: low quality post meaning your post should creative and meaningfulNOTE: avoid plagiarism is very important if you engage your self in it once they catch you is direct ban completely.

comments.author: martyns
comments.body: Quote from: Dzwaafu11 on February 11, 2023, 09:20:43 PMYou're welcome to bitcointalk forum where you can learn many things cryptocurrency and bitcoin.All you have to do is to follow the rules and regulation there many things that are not allowed in these forum.1: plagiarism2: low quality post meaning your post should creative and meaningfulNOTE: avoid plagiarism is very important if you engage your self in it once they catch you is direct ban completely. So many people who have engaged in plagiarism have been kicked out of this forum,and this is one of the reasons why I said bitcointalk is not for everybody,it's for people who are brainy,intelligent and smart enough to create ideas from their brain and be able to make constructive posts that are meaningful to the ears of readers.The forum is an educative one that teaches about Bitcoin,and how to make money in crypto.In this forum,Ideas and contribution are given in order for newbies to learn from.Only quality posts are accepted in this forum,low quality posts are not too welcomed here.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Quote from: collinscoinz on February 07, 2023, 02:44:10 PMPlease am new here and i realy want to know,and lean more about this forum and it operation.how can some one that is new like me lean any thing important from this forum that will be of benefit to those that are new.when no body is ready to teach or reply topics,i want to ask how can some one have his own wallet, have seen the benefits of this forum from a friend that introduced me,i wanna grow also like others so please forum mates please help me out share knowledge with me that can help me as well be of help also to others thanks very much.. Just as other members have already stated and told you, one of the greatest rule in this forum is avoiding plagiarism (copying works of others without referencing it) and this very offence is frown so much at and there are high risk of getting banned especially from newbie accounts.Rather than making things hard for yourself, why not go meet the person that referred you, so he can help hold your hands and make your journey easier for you.
